hash.description:
Will be computed by the service

hash of the content

challenge.description:
Will be computed by the service

hash of the content prefixed by 'WEBDA'

metadata.description: Metadatas stored along with the binary

url.description: URL on which to serve the content

model.description: Webda model to use within the Store

additionalModels.description:
Additional models

Allow this store to manage other models

strict.description:
Allow to load object that does not have the type data

If set to true, then the Store will only managed the defined _model and no model extending this one

defaultModel.description: When __type model not found, use the model If strict is setup this parameter is not used

forceModel.description: If set, Store will ignore the __type

modelAliases.description: Model Aliases to allow easier rename of Model

mongoUrl.description:
Contains the URL to Mongo Server

Will try to use WEBDA_MONDO_URL environment variable if not defined

options.description:
Additional options for Mongo connetion

Should be typed with MongoClientOptions but not available due to bug in ts-json-schema-generator https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/connection-string

w.description: Request acknowledgment that the write operation has propagated to a specified number of mongod instances or to mongod instances with specified tags.

journal.description: Request acknowledgment that the write operation has been written to the on-disk journal

wtimeoutMS.description: Specify a time limit to prevent write operations from blocking indefinitely

wtimeout.description: Specify a time limit to prevent write operations from blocking indefinitely.
wtimeout.deprecated: Will be removed in the next major version. Please use wtimeoutMS.

j.description: Request acknowledgment that the write operation has been written to the on-disk journal.
j.deprecated: Will be removed in the next major version. Please use journal.

fsync.deprecated: Will be removed in the next major version. Please use journal.

anyOf.description: A MongoDB WriteConcern, which describes the level of acknowledgement requested from MongoDB for write operations.

j.deprecated: Will be removed in the next major version. Please use the journal option.

wtimeout.deprecated: Will be removed in the next major version. Please use the wtimeoutMS option.

fsync.deprecated: Will be removed in the next major version. Please use the journal option.

useBigInt64.description: when deserializing a Long return as a BigInt.

promoteLongs.description: when deserializing a Long will fit it into a Number if it's smaller than 53 bits.

promoteBuffers.description: when deserializing a Binary will return it as a node.js Buffer instance.

promoteValues.description: when deserializing will promote BSON values to their Node.js closest equivalent types.

fieldsAsRaw.description: allow to specify if there what fields we wish to return as unserialized raw buffer.

bsonRegExp.description: return BSON regular expressions as BSONRegExp instances.

raw.description: Enabling the raw option will return a [Node.js Buffer](https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html) which is allocated using [allocUnsafe API](https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#static-method-bufferallocunsafesize). See this section from the [Node.js Docs here](https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#what-makes-bufferallocunsafe-and-bufferallocunsafeslow-unsafe) for more detail about what "unsafe" refers to in this context. If you need to maintain your own editable clone of the bytes returned for an extended life time of the process, it is recommended you allocate your own buffer and clone the contents:

checkKeys.description: the serializer will check if keys are valid.

ignoreUndefined.description: serialize will not emit undefined fields note that the driver sets this to `false`

enableUtf8Validation.description: Enable utf8 validation when deserializing BSON documents.  Defaults to true.

authSource.description: If the database authentication is dependent on another databaseName.

forceServerObjectId.description: Force server to assign _id values instead of driver.

readPreference.description: The preferred read preference (ReadPreference.PRIMARY, ReadPreference.PRIMARY_PREFERRED, ReadPreference.SECONDARY, ReadPreference.SECONDARY_PREFERRED, ReadPreference.NEAREST).

pkFactory.description: A primary key factory object for generation of custom _id keys.

readConcern.description: Specify a read concern for the collection. (only MongoDB 3.2 or higher supported)

enabled.description: Explicitly enable or disable hedged reads.

anyOf.description: The **ReadPreference** class is a class that represents a MongoDB ReadPreference and is used to construct connections.
